level 1.Description: Smart energy contracts implement the policies outlined in the Energy Efficiency Policy to promote energy-saving practices.
Smart energy contracts provide funding for various renewable energy projects to support the transition to clean energy sources.
Smart energy contracts focus on the implementation of demand response programs to manage electricity consumption during peak periods.
Smart energy contracts operate within the energy market to facilitate the trading and exchange of energy resources.
Smart energy contracts form partnerships with energy service companies to provide energy management solutions to consumers.
Smart energy contracts contribute to the reduction of carbon emissions by promoting the use of renewable energy sources and energy-efficient practices.
Smart energy contracts monitor energy consumption patterns to identify opportunities for energy optimization and efficiency improvements.
Smart energy contracts set targets for energy savings to incentivize consumers and businesses to adopt energy-efficient practices.

level 2.Subject: energy efficiency
level 2.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

level 2.Subject: energy efficiency
level 2.Description: Energy efficiency employs energy audits to identify energy-saving opportunities and optimize energy use.

level 2.Subject: renewable energy agencies
level 2.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

level 2.Subject: renewable energy agencies
level 2.Description: Renewable energy agencies collaborate with research institutions to advance scientific knowledge and develop new technologies for renewable energy generation.

level 2.Subject: energy storage
level 2.Description: Energy storage addresses the issue of intermittency in renewable energy sources by storing excess energy for use during periods of low generation.

level 2.Subject: energy storage
level 2.Description: Energy storage employs battery technologies to store and release energy efficiently, enabling the integration of renewable energy sources into the grid.

level 3.Subject: energy storage
level 3.Description: Energy storage addresses the issue of intermittency in renewable energy sources by storing excess energy for use during periods of low generation.

level 3.Subject: energy markets
level 3.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

level 3.Subject: renewable energy certificates
level 3.Description: Renewable energy certificates are implemented by the Energy Efficiency Policy to promote the use of renewable energy sources.
